content:
I'd like to work on the CStr method mentioned here, but I've never contributed to the std library before.

I could use a bit of help understanding the process. Would someone be willing to advise/mentor me through this?

I'm not even sure how to get started: should I just post a PR? Or does there need to be an issue (tracking issue?) first?

You can start with a PR and note that a tracking issue is still needed and wait for reviewer feedback first. If it didn't have much prior discussion someone might suggest a different API or something. But I've also seen people create a PR + tracking issue at the same time.

There also is a std dev guide but... well

Status: Stub
Am I correct in assuming that there needs to be a feature-gate, for a new std lib member fn?
yes, you can pick whatever name you like for the feature gate, no bikeshedding needed

Ugh, the feature gate name I wanted was already used so I picked a terrible one :)
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/94984
